abstract: Rochelle Sterling and her lawyer are using a clause in the Los Angeles Clippers trust documents to cut her husband Donald out of the deal to sell franchise to Steve Ballmer for $2 billion after doctors found Sterling to be affected by cognitive impairment; closely held legal maneuver capped hectic, weeks-long effort to wrest control of team from Donald Sterling after his racial comments.
lead_paragraph: Rochelle Sterling and her lawyer used a clause in the Clippers trust documents to cut her husband, Donald, out of the deal after doctors found him to be affected by cognitive impairment.
